title: Emmerdale spoiler: Rebecca has a cunning plan to mend Lawrence and Chrissie's relationship... while Emma frets about Finn
text:

She's had her fair share of troubles since coming to the village married to Robert Sugden. 
But it seems that Chrissie's problems are far from over as her paranoia over her father's boyfriend Ronnie has seen her get her marching orders from Home Farm in Wednesday night's Emmerdale . 
And as Lawrence stays firm on his promise to boot his eldest, and most problematic, daughter out of the estate's very grand doors, her sister, Rebecca, has an ingenious plan to keep the family from breaking apart. 
Emmerdale's 'prison homophobia' storyline triggers 180 complaints to TV watchdog 
As Chrissie says one last goodbye to the house and her upset father, the feisty blonde takes her chance and handcuffs the warring father and daughter together. 
Standing aghast that Lawrence has no way of escaping Chrisse, Ronnie looks on, and the gruff builder is faced with a decision to make. But will he tell his boyfriend that he set Chrissie up on purpose? Or, will he chose to keep quiet and let the family tear itself apart? 
Elsewhere, Emma fears Finn is making a mistake by going to Australia alone - though the heartbroken Barton boy has other ideas. 
'This is breaking my heart': Emmerdale fans left 'distraught' as Aaron Dingle's harrowing and shocking prison storyline continues 
Fretting over her youngest son, the bunny-boiling husband-killer is terrified that he'll move forever out of her demented clutches, leaving her with just Ross and Pete to meddle with. 
Meanwhile, there's more drama bubbling up to the surface in other parts of the village, as tension mounts when Vanessa criticises Pierce's controlling behaviour towards Rhona. 
As Laurel puts her own fears over Ashley to one side, she tries to help ease Rhona's doubts over the wedding. But if she has any major doubts, Rhona doesn't show them as she sets a date for the ceremony - six weeks' from now. 
Other minor dramas include the ever-fretful Jacob worrying and panicking after he looses his lucky coin, while Tracy asks David to model for her book cover - possibly confusing him with Yorkshire's answer to David Gandy. Like us on Facebook
